Olivier Assayas' film stars Asia Argento as a woman who had a relationship with Michael Madsen. Madsen is a business man who buys and sells sex in pairs: premium male company with aristocratic female partner – the ultimate aphrodesiac he declares.
But then…a tragedy unfolds.
Argento’s chameleon-like lead performance is at times breezy, tragic, funny and utterly unrelenting – and potentially mesmerising for some.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that an alien organism called Vaterra has killed them and turned them into camouflage monsters that never stop moving. While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, they channel their problems over into other aspects of their lives until they are engulfed in payback wrath by another group of stick-up victims. (The wild-eyed ones with two spoons cut up into a heart shape on their faces were a great touch.)

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you in and reminds me Strawberry Fields Forever and A Clockwork Orange. Which I think were consciously or unconsciously referenced by those directing. The aesthetics are great but also foreseen enough.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to create a cult phenomenon like the John Woo Bruce Lee martial arts films of the Sixties and Seventies.
